summary: This is an ex parte letter from the U.S. Attorney's Office to Judge Engelmayer regarding a FOIA lawsuit by The New York Times seeking Jeffrey Epstein-related records. The letter updates the court on the status of the criminal case United States v. Noel and requests an extension of production deadlines, citing ongoing negotiations for deferred prosecution agreements in that case.

persons.name: Paul A. Engelmayer
persons.context: The judge presiding over the FOIA case The New York Times Co. v. Federal Bureau of Prisons. The letter is addressed to him.

persons.name: Audrey Strauss
persons.context: The United States Attorney for the Southern District of New York who is respectfully submitting the letter to the court.

persons.name: Steven J. Kochevar
persons.context: The attorney who authored and signed the letter on behalf of the U.S. Attorney's Office.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The FOIA action brought by The New York Times seeks records related to him.

connections.description: Strauss is the United States Attorney and Kochevar is an Assistant United States Attorney in her office.
Kochevar, as an AUSA, is formally communicating with and making requests to Judge Engelmayer regarding the FOIA case.

events.title: Government Requests Extension in Epstein FOIA Case
events.description: The U.S. Attorney's Office files an ex parte letter with Judge Engelmayer requesting an extension of deadlines in the FOIA lawsuit for Epstein records, citing ongoing resolution of the related criminal case United States v. Noel.

events.title: Deferred Prosecution Negotiations in Noel Case
events.description: The government reports it has preliminarily approved deferred prosecution agreements for both defendants in United States v. Noel and submitted them to Pretrial Services for review and investigation.

keyFacts: The document is part of a FOIA lawsuit (The New York Times Co. v. Federal Bureau of Prisons) seeking the release of records related to Jeffrey Epstein.
The government is requesting an extension of production deadlines, citing the pending resolution of a related criminal case, United States v. Noel.
The government states it has preliminarily approved deferred prosecution agreements for both defendants in the Noel case, pending Pretrial Services review.
The letter is filed ex parte and under seal due to the sensitive nature of the ongoing Noel case negotiations.
